;罗伯特·汉森，臭名昭著的 FBI 双重间谍，秘密向俄罗斯提供了一些美国最深的秘密监狱官员说，汉森曾在 1980 年代和 1990 年代生活过，周一死于戒备森严的监狱。

;

;1985 年，汉森向苏联军事情报部门自首，交易政府机密和美国间谍在苏联和苏联的身份。俄罗斯政府以换取钻石和数十万美元。

;

;因为他在 FBI 重要的纽约反情报部门工作，负责追捕外国间谍，所以他能够掩盖自己的踪迹，因为他表面上调查了莫斯科在美国的特工。

;

;2001 年 2 月 18 日，他在华盛顿郊外的弗吉尼亚郊区与他的俄罗斯经纪人交换信息，最终被抓获。一年后，他被判刑终身监禁，不得假释。

;

;根据一份监狱声明，79 岁的汉森周一早些时候被发现在科罗拉多州佛罗伦萨戒备森严的美国监狱中失去知觉，随后被宣布死亡.

;

;联邦调查局称他为“该局历史上最具破坏性的间谍”。

;

;汉森在芝加哥担任警察后，于 1976 年加入联邦调查局。九年后，他在纽约市办公室担任反情报职位，特工们投入大量时间跟踪并试图在联合国招募苏联官员。

;

;相反，在很短的时间内他以“Ramon Garcia”的名义向另一方提供服务，甚至他的手下也不知道他的真实身份。

;

;五角大楼泄密事件：为什么 21 岁的美国警卫人员拥有绝密权限< /h3>;

;在他被捕时，他被认为是向外国政府泄露美国机密的最具破坏性的内奸，数以千计的美国机密文件被移交给了苏联，后来又移交给了俄罗斯。< /p>;

;其中包括美国核战争计划、跟踪间谍调查的软件，以及在莫斯科的美国消息来源的身份，其中包括 Dmitri Polyakov 或“Tophat”，他是一名苏联将军，在中美之间向美国提供了他的国家的机密。 1960 年代和 1980 年代。

;

;Polyakov 于 1986 年被捕，几年后被处决。

;

;据信，Hanssen 是出于金钱和阴谋而非意识形态的动机，获得了大约 140 万美元的现金

;

;虽然多年来联邦调查局和中央情报局都知道他们的队伍中有一名位置优越的线人，但汉森很长一段时间都不是头号嫌疑犯。

;

;他有妻子和六个孩子，生活节俭，与华盛顿保守的天主教精英关系密切。

;

;美国调查人员最终通过一名俄罗斯叛逃者提供的少量信息将更多注意力转向汉森。

;

;他在他的办公室被秘密跟踪和记录了几个月，然后在弗吉尼亚死角被捕。

;

;俄罗斯称美国在间谍阴谋中获取了数千部苹果手机

;

;在2002 年 5 月，他承认了 15 项间谍罪，以换取不寻求死刑的起诉协议。

;

;“我为我的行为道歉。我为此感到羞耻。”汉森在宣判时说。

;

;“我为诽谤我完全无辜的妻子和孩子打开了大门，”他说。 “我深深地伤害了很多人。”

;中国本土种植的榴莲有望在本月上市，但它据一位热带水果专家称，绝大多数消费者可能需要数年时间才能买到它，而且最近几个月预计产量的估计值急剧下降。

;

;在热带岛屿省份海南经过四年多的种植，农民们正在为全国首次大规模的国产榴莲收获做准备。他们热衷于利用国内对这种迅速成为中国最受欢迎的进口水果不断增长的需求获利——这种水果原产于东南亚，以其独特的强烈气味而闻名。

;

;但是 Feng Xuejie，据中央电视台报道，海南省农业科学院热带果树研究所和海南省农业科学院的一名研究员预计，海南今年将仅生产约 50 吨（110,000 磅）榴莲周六。这仅占中国今年食用的榴莲总量的 0.005% 左右。

;

;新的预计产量远低于央视 3 月份报道的 2,450 吨。

;< p>;上个月，红星新闻媒体援引冯某的话称，3月份的数字被“高估”了，因为“还没有大面积挂果”。

;

;“一些他在 5 月份说。

;

;中国将在 6 月份吃到第一批本地榴莲。马来西亚人和泰国人的主导地位是否受到威胁？

;

;周六，他告诉中央电视台：“中国人每年消耗 100 万吨榴莲。”此外，他还说：“海南现在开花结果的榴莲树，有些还不成熟，不能结出多少果实。”

;

;因此，海南可能还需要几年时间才能结出果实。冯说，生产足够的榴莲足以降低国内价格。同时，那里种植的榴莲不会很便宜，因为新生作物的生产成本高于东南亚国家。

;

;中央电视台 3 月份还报道说，榴莲种植园占地近 700 公顷（1,700 公顷）亩）在海南岛最南端的城市三亚。但 Feng 在 5 月份表示，“全省花地总面积”只有 70 公顷左右。

;

;虽然 Feng 现在预计这些数字将在三到五年内出现巨大改善，但国内价格可能直到整个种植面积超过20,000-30,000公顷才受到影响。

;

;本月收获的榴莲将分配给海南的潜在客户开发市场，其余的可能会供当地游客消费，冯在周六补充道。因此，即使有榴莲，全国其他地区的消费者也可能无法购买。

;

;“中国正在建立自主的植物育种体系，正在努力培育具有自主知识产权的榴莲品种产权以支持工业发展，”冯说。

;

;中国押注其本土作物将有助于降低国内价格，利用不断增长的水果消费，并促进该国的国际农产品贸易。但国产榴莲能否成功，关键在于与东南亚进口榴莲相比，消费者是否觉得它可口。

;

;这种热带水果在中国的价格大幅上涨，而且经常在市场上迅速售罄。

;

;中国的榴莲需求如何让一些亚洲国家感到苦涩

;

;今年第一季度，越南出口了价值 1.53 亿美元的榴莲，是去年同期的 7.3 倍.根据商务部的数据，中国占了总数的 87%。

;

;消费者目前预计在电子商务中为 7 公斤越南榴莲支付约 349 元人民币（50 美元）京东网站，必须提前下单。来自泰国和马来西亚的榴莲目前在淘宝运营的在线购物平台天猫超市销售一空。

;

;其他国家也在利用中国对榴莲日益增长的胃口。

;

;1 月, 菲律宾总统小费迪南德·马科斯访问北京期间与中国签署了一项贸易协定，该协定预计将为菲律宾当地的榴莲产业带来 2.6 亿美元的收入。

;

;该国首个据菲律宾农业部称，总计 28 吨的榴莲货物于 4 月 6 日抵达中国。

; Tue, 06 Jun 2023 05:20:02 +0800 South China Sea: three barriers to a fully fledged Philippines-Vietnam alliancehttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3222656/south-china-sea-three-barriers-fully-fledged-philippines-vietnam-alliance?utm_source=rss_feed

;总统小费迪南德·马科斯首先谈到了菲律宾与越南“蓬勃发展”的关系去年 11 月在柬埔寨举行的东盟峰会期间，他会见了总理范明正。

;

;当月晚些时候，这位菲律宾总统在马拉坎南宫会见了越南国民议会议长 Vuong Dinh Hue，他的特别代表来宾谈到需要“做更多事情来加强我们政党之间的关系以及政府与政府之间以及议会与议会之间的关系”。

;

;上个月，Marcos Jnr 在场边再次会见了 Pham东盟峰会在印度尼西亚继续讨论，包括南海争端。马科斯强调有必要“真诚交谈”和“找到方法”，以确保两国——东南亚国家联盟的两个成员国——在建立全面战略伙伴关系的更广泛努力中解决争端。

;

;不久之后，两国在越南举行了第 10 次海事和海洋问题高级别联合常设工作组会议，以更好地协调南海立场，探讨合作，特别是在海上安全方面。

;< p>;种种迹象表明，出于对中国在邻近海域不断扩大足迹的担忧，两国决心探索事实上的联盟。但任何实质性的菲越合作都必须应对战略和意识形态疑虑、中国的经济主导地位以及该地区大国竞争加剧的连锁反应。

;

;冷战期间的对手，菲律宾马尼拉和河内拥有对美国在越南的行动至关重要的美国基地，在整个 1990 年代建立了越来越友好的关系。特别是，拉莫斯政府支持共产主义的越南加入东盟，该集团主要由亲西方政权建立。

;

;作为南中国海的主要声索国，两国在制定区域海事法典方面进行了广泛协调行为，为 2002 年东盟与中国之间的《南海各方行为宣言》铺平了道路。 2000 年代中期，阿罗约政府将河内纳入与北京在南中国海的三边能源勘探协议，双边关系进入了一个新阶段。

;

;然而，战略关系的决定性时刻到来了2010 年，河内作为东盟主席寻求美国对南海争端的更大干预。这最终导致奥巴马政府史无前例地宣布，它将把有争议水域的航行自由视为“国家利益”问题，为美国海军在该地区的更大存在铺平了道路。

;

;根据在阿基诺政府执政期间，马尼拉开始寻求与河内建立“战略伙伴关系”，因为与北京在南中国海的紧张局势日益加剧。越南和菲律宾军队在有争议的南沙群岛举行体育赛事，而外交官则在处理针对中国的潜在联合仲裁案。

;

;随着越南海军越来越多地部署到马尼拉进行友好访问，阿基诺与他的总统举行了高层会谈越南同行巩固对华同盟。

;

;该同盟受到美国的悄悄鼓励，这分别有助于加强两国的海上安全能力。但罗德里戈·杜特尔特 (Rodrigo Duterte) 是一位支持加强与北京的关系并猛烈抨击西方盟友的民粹主义者，他的当选破坏了这个新兴的联盟。

;

;更糟糕的是，越南渔民与菲律宾海军之间发生了一场激烈的冲突，只是一个进入杜特尔特任期的一年。在接下来的五年里，杜特尔特在很大程度上冷落了他的越南同行，他们对菲律宾外交政策的根本转变感到惊讶。

;

;自上任以来，马科斯试图通过承认两国的共同战略利益来重振与越南的关系也不愿仅仅依靠西方盟友来对抗中国。尽管如此，建立成熟的菲律宾-越南联盟仍存在三个主要障碍。

;

;首先，双方都存在一定程度的不信任。菲律宾的许多人，包括外交界人士，都感到被越南欺骗了。当马尼拉于 2013 年向北京提起南海仲裁案时，据报道越南对话者暗示他们将很快提起平行诉讼以支持。

;

;当这种情况没有发生时，许多菲律宾人怀疑河内正在让菲律宾在坐享其成的同时，承担了所有风险。与此同时，河内因菲律宾外交政策的根本转变而伤痕累累，担心与看似不可靠的邻国建立长期伙伴关系的可行性。

;

;这将我们带到第二个问题：战略和意识形态差异.尽管菲律宾的外交政策不稳定，但其自由民主的政治制度和受过五角大楼训练的国防机构仍与西方大体保持一致。这一点尤其重要，因为拜登政府的民主议程激怒了越南的共产党领导层，他们公开担心西方的“颜色革命”议程。

;

;再次向北京的共产党兄弟求爱的河内将有对与华盛顿和/或其地区盟友（如马尼拉）完全结盟的疑虑。此外，河内不能完全疏远北京这个顶级贸易和投资伙伴。

;

;越南的理想位置是与美国和中国保持战略等距

;

;同时，民族主义和北京友好菲律宾的声音越来越关注越南在南中国海的扩张足迹，指出其在有争议海域的填海造地和军事化活动。一位著名的亲北京菲律宾评论员甚至公开将越南描述为南中国海“更严重的威胁”。

;

;最后，一个强大的联盟存在操作上的限制。菲律宾全副武装的美军和越南全副武装的俄罗斯军队在技术和作战上缺乏兼容性。这可能会使任何大型演习、武器转让和更密切军事合作的计划复杂化，即使两国决定加强在南中国海的情报共享和外交协调。

;

;简而言之，一个完全成熟的菲越联盟虽然诱人，但不太可能很快实现。

; Tue, 06 Jun 2023 02:50:01 +0800 US and Chinese diplomats held ‘candid and productive discussions’ in Beijing: State Departmenthttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3223048/us-and-chinese-diplomats-held-candid-and-productive-discussions-beijing-state-department?utm_source=rss_feed

;美国和中国高级外交官周一在北京举行了“坦诚而富有成效的讨论”美国国务院表示，正在努力保持沟通渠道畅通，并在两国最近的外交提议的基础上再接再厉。

;

;美国负责东亚和太平洋事务的助理国务卿丹尼尔·克里滕布林克 (Daniel Kritenbrink)自 2 月初在美国领空被指称的中国间谍气球被击落后，一位官员证实曾访问过中国——会见了外交部常务副外长马朝旭。克里滕布林克为期一周的访问还将包括在新西兰停留。

;

;“双方就双边关系、两岸问题、沟通渠道等问题交换了意见，”美国国务院在一份声明中说。周一的简短读数。 “美国官员明确表示，美国将积极参与竞争，并捍卫美国的利益和价值观。”

;

;在随后的简报中，国务院副发言人韦丹特·帕特尔补充说，双方还讨论了气候问题、芬太尼前体、人权和被错误拘留的美国公民。

;

;此行是在中央情报局局长威廉·伯恩斯上个月秘密访问中国以及商务部长王文涛和吉娜·雷蒙多最近在华盛顿会晤的报道之后进行的。美国国家安全顾问 Jake Sullivan 和中国高级外交官王毅也在奥地利会面。

;

;Kritenbrink 本周的中国之行由美国国家安全委员会中国和台湾事务高级主管 Sarah Beran 陪同安理会，美国驻华大使伯恩斯也参加了会议。三人还会见了外交部北美和大洋洲事务司的杨涛。

;

;此次高级别会议是在美国和中国国防部长在周末在新加坡举行的香格里拉对话会。

;

;在不同的会议上，李尚福和劳埃德·奥斯汀就台湾和地区安全问题交换了言辞。

;

;会议因中美之间的亲密接触而蒙上阴影星期六在台湾海峡的美国和中国军舰。美国指责中国军舰在美国驱逐舰前方横穿，进行“不安全”机动。

;

;中国敦促美国采取“具体行动”，阻止两国关系进一步恶化

;

;中国军方辩称其行动是“必要措施”，并指责美国是“蓄意挑衅”。

;

;

;但是他们没有。这是共和党党内战争的一个重要发展，在那些放弃了华盛顿试图在全世界推广的民主价值观的人与那些仍然坚持罗纳德里根的美国和平愿景的人之间。

;

;有人们担心众议院规则委员会中的极右翼共和党人会阻止债务上限法案的通过，在该委员会中，德克萨斯州的奇普罗伊等强硬派获得了席位，以便麦卡锡获得议长的木槌。然而，这些都被夸大了。

;

;该法案在众议院轻松通过。虽然许多投赞成票的共和党人就支出失控发出了可怕的警告，但其中一个抱怨应该给那些支持共和党传统主义者的人带来希望：担心五角大楼将如何支持乌克兰阻止俄罗斯入侵的努力。

;

;“我们现在在世界上有很多麻烦的地区。 Politico 援引科罗拉多州共和党众议员道格·兰博恩的话说，不仅乌克兰，而且中国仍然是我们必须应对的日益严重的威胁。参议院议员、参议院拨款委员会成员、南卡罗来纳州共和党人林赛·格雷厄姆和缅因州拨款委员会高级共和党人苏珊·柯林斯都对北京和莫斯科构成的军事威胁不断上升​​发出警告。

;

;“避免危机”：拜登在椭圆形办公室的首次演讲中庆祝债务上限协议

;

;

;“没有工作的人不健康、不快乐、不自由，”肯尼迪说。换句话说，工作让你自由——这一建议让人想起 20 世纪历史上特别可怕的一章。

;

;然而，肯尼迪提出的一项拯救闲散富人的法案与他呼吁将骄傲节定为国定假日的可能性一样大。共和党关于工作让我们自由的信息并不适合那些以数百万美元拍卖马格利特和毕加索的人。

;但我们不要纠缠于共和党的矛盾或其右翼为拖美国后腿所做的努力到了一个同性恋者躲在壁橱里，女人留在厨房里，少数族裔坐在公共汽车后座的时代。相反，让我们细细品味共和党人愿意与民主党人合作以避免全球灾难的程度。

;中国周一猛烈抨击欧盟针对北京的贸易措施，声称他们会对世界贸易体系造成“严重影响”。

;

;在日内瓦举行的世界贸易组织 (WTO) 会议上，中国大使李成钢谴责了一系列旨在解决欧洲与中国长期贸易争端的欧盟政策.

;

;他抨击外国补贴法、投资审查和关键的矿产法，称其“不合理且具有歧视性”。据一位日内瓦贸易消息人士称，《欧洲芯片法》也被批评为“扩大出口管制措施”和提高补贴的幌子。

;

;没有任何措施直接提到中国，但它们是为了应对北京的政策而制定的欧盟官员私下承认，WTO 规则无法应对。

;

;这些政策也经过精心设计，以符合 WTO 规则，即使布鲁塞尔预计其中一些政策会在日内瓦贸易中受到挑战

;

;作为这一强有力的新贸易立场的一部分，欧盟官员正准备在本月晚些时候提出一项新的经济安全战略。它将建议限制欧洲对人工智能、半导体和量子计算等敏感高科技领域的部分投资。

;

;同样，该战略预计不会将中国列为目标，但它是首次宣布的在欧盟委员会主席乌尔苏拉·冯德莱恩 3 月份就中国发表的主旨演讲中，该演讲提出了“降低”双边贸易关系风险的计划。

;

;欧盟委员会贸易总干事萨宾·魏安德 (Sabine Weyand)欧盟委员会周一表示，“在当前地缘战略环境中，系统性竞争的不确定性和风险增加”是需要该政策的。

;

;此次交流是在欧盟贸易政策审查会议上进行的，这是一个三年一度的论坛，其他国家世贸组织成员可以表达不满。

;

;中国和其他一些国家对布鲁塞尔的气候政策开枪，包括气候碳边界调整机制 (CBAM)。

;

; CBAM 预计将于 10 月成立，是欧盟寻求到 2050 年实现气候中和的基石。在它全面生效后，想要向欧盟销售商品的公司必须购买反映生产过程中产生的排放量的证书。

;

;据消息人士称，李表示这将不公平地惩罚发展中国家 - 这是南半球普遍存在的抱怨。

;

;欧盟的净零工业法案，未来可能会限制李说，中国向欧盟出口电池、风能和太阳能设备“违反了多边贸易体制的市场原则和基本规则”。

;

;中国寻求世贸组织审查芯片出口限制由美国领导

;

;欧盟的气候政策为在会议期间发言的其他世贸组织成员的官员提供了充足的素材。来自台湾的一名成员敦促布鲁塞尔努力“减轻对 CBAM 的潜在影响和担忧”。

;

;俄罗斯表示，该税将“从根本上挑战全球商品流动的结构和竞争状况

;

;为捍卫欧盟的绿色政策，Weyand 表示，“国内政策制定对于履行《巴黎协定》的承诺至关重要，不采取任何行动是一种选择”，消息人士称。

;

;在不那么激烈的言论中，中国赞扬了“欧盟在维持世贸组织运转方面发挥的重要作用”。两人都是替代上诉法院的成员，该法院在美国阻止任命新法官进入传统上诉机构后不得不成立。

;

;李还赞扬了欧盟为实现“战略自主”所做的努力，这是一个中国官员经常用这个词来形容任何在欧洲和美国之间拉开距离的政策。

;

;华盛顿驻世贸组织特使玛丽亚·帕甘 (María Pagán) 也提供了一份关于欧盟贸易政策的投诉清单，包括其“危害基于法规的方法”——根据接触化学品来限制市场准入——以及使用地理标志来阻止美国葡萄酒出口商在进入欧洲市场时使用“茶色、红宝石和城堡”等术语。

;世界上最大的加密货币交易所 Binance 及其首席执行官赵长鹏经营着一个“欺骗网络” ”，美国证券交易委员会周一称，这包括人为夸大其交易量和转移客户资产。

;

;该机构周一起诉 Binance 和 Zhao 未能限制美国客户使用其平台并误导投资者关于其市场监控控制以及经营未注册证券交易所的问题。

;

;美国证券交易委员会向华盛顿联邦法院提起的诉讼还指控币安和赵秘密控制客户的资产，允许他们混合and divert customer funds, and that Binance created separate US entities “as part of an elaborate scheme to evade US federal securities laws”.

;

;The SEC also alleged that from at least September 2019 until June 2022, Sigma Chain , a trading firm owned and controlled by Zhao, engaged in wash trading that artificially inflated the trading volume of cryptocurrency asset securities on the Binance.US Platform.

;

;“We allege that Zhao and Binance entities engaged in an extensive web of deception, conflicts of interest, lack of disclosure, and calculated evasion of the law,” said SEC Chair Gary Gensler said in a statement.

;

;Binance did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the charges . In a tweet, Zhao said Binance would issue a response once it has reviewed the SEC's complaint, and said the exchange's team is “standing by, ensuring systems are stable, including withdrawals, and deposits”.

;

;Binance's cryptocurrency BNB, the world's fourth largest by market size, dropped more than 5 per cent on the news.

;

;The move is the latest in a series of legal woes for Binance, which was also sued by the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) in March for operating what the regulator alleged were an “illegal” exchange and a “sham” compliance programme, with Zhao calling those charges “disappointing” and an “incomplete recitation of facts”.

;

;How China's crypto king went from McDonald's to billionaire

;

;Binance is also under investigation by the Justice Department for suspected money laundering and sanctions violations, according to people familiar with the probe.

;

;The world's biggest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance was founded in Shanghai in 2017 by CEO Changpeng Zhao, a Canadian citizen born and raised until the age of 12 in China.

;

;While its holding company is based in the Cayman Islands, Binance says it does not have a headquarters and has declined to state the location of its main Binance.com exchange.

;

;Binance's global trading platform, Binance.com dominates the cryptocurrency trading landscape, last year processing trades worth about US$65 billion a day with up to 70 per cent of the market.

;

;The firm has processed at least US$10 billion in payments for criminals and companies seeking to evade US sanctions, Reuters has previously reported.

;

;Reuters also reported on May 23 that Binance commingled its customers' funds with its corporate revenues in Silvergate Bank account belonging to trading firm Merit Peak, in breach of US financial rules that require client money to be kept separate.

;

;Binance denied mixing customer deposits and company funds, saying that users who sent money to the account were not making deposits but rather buying Binance's bespoke dollar-linked cryptocurrency token.

;Hong Kong faces a “difficult and challenging” task in rebuilding its role as an aviation hub, while the city's flag carrier Cathay Pacific Airways is expected to operate at only 60 per cent of its pre-pandemic capacity by the end of the year, the head of a global airline association has said.

;

;But the outlook for the industry as a whole was positive, director general of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) Willie Walsh told its annual meeting in Istanbul on Monday, predicting global profits would reach US$9.8 billion this year, double its forecast in December, on the back of stronger demand for travel.

;

;Walsh told the Post last December he did not expect Hong Kong would fully regain its status as an aviation hub before 2028, pointing to “structural changes” in the city following three years of Covid-19 travel restrictions.

;

;Asked again about his earlier comments, Walsh admitted his timeline was based on a “feeling” about where Hong Kong was in the recovery process compared with rivals.

;

;“It is rebuilding, but I think it has lost an awful lot of ground and that lost ground is going to take time to recover,” he said, adding it was going to be a “very difficult and challenging task”.

;

;Cathay faced a complex process in rebuilding its international network, Walsh argued.

;

;“I think Cathay will be operating at 60 per cent capacity this year as they retrain pilots, many of whom have not flown in the past two years,” he said.

;

;Cathay and its budget arm HK Express have set a target of reaching 70 per cent of pre-pandemic passenger flight capacity by the end of the year and 100 per cent at the end of 2024.

;

;Flights at Cathay budget carrier HK Express 'back to pre-Covid levels by Friday'

;

;Hong Kong lifted Covid-19 restrictions on international arrivals last December and resumed quarantine-free travel with mainland China in February.

;

;Independent aviation analyst Brendan Sobie said Hong Kong was a year behind other places, such as Singapore, in restoring its aviation industry to 2019 levels.

;

;Foreign airlines had faced challenges in increasing services to the Hong Kong International Airport due to shortages of ground handling staff, he said, but added “over time” the issue would be resolved.

;

;“There are still some lingering issues, but it's better than it was,” Sobie said. “It is a gradual process for airlines that want to add more capacity to Hong Kong, but haven't been able to.”

;

;IATA on Monday said the global airline industry was expected to make US$9.8 billion in net profits in 2023, and total revenue was expected to grow 9.7 per cent year on year to US$803 billion. The organisation said net industry losses for last year were now estimated to be US$3.6 billion.

;

;Carriers such as Singapore Airlines and Emirates have posted record profits, ahead of the summer season.

;

;Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific appoints Ronald Lam CEO as it builds capacity

;

;About 4.35 billion people are expected to travel in 2023, about 95 per cent the number who flew in 2019, according to the trade body.

;

;The pent-up demand to fly has helped to keep airfares between 15 and 40 per cent higher than pre-pandemic prices, according to Hong Kong travel agents.

;

;But the supply of flights is also being affected by delays on aircraft deliveries and the complicated process of bringing back parked aircraft, in addition to higher oil prices, and staff shortages.

;

;IATA chief economist Marie Owens Thomsen said she was “amazed” passengers were not put off by the higher air fares.

;

;“Logically speaking, you would think that this cannot last forever, that at some point, passengers will become more price sensitive,” she said.

;

;Economic uncertainties such as high inflation and rising unemployment rates could have an impact moving forward, Thomsen added.

;

;Mainland China is a crucial component of the recovery of the global aviation industry. In 2019, mainland travellers made more than 150 million international trips, spending about US$1 trillion.

;

;Flights to and from China carried about 2.2 million passengers in the first three months of the year, or 12.4 per cent of the number during the first quarter of 2019, before the coronavirus outbreak, according to the Civil Aviation Administration of China.

;

;Thomsen said questions remained about the shape of the recovery of the Chinese travel market, noting the number of international flights departing from the mainland remained at “a very low level.”

;

;Most mainland Chinese fly overseas via Hong Kong amid lack of flight options: IATA

;

;Countries were increasing flights to China, with the “noticeable exception” of the United States, which Thomsen said was due to geopolitical factors.

;

;On Sunday, IATA vice-president for North Asia Xie Xingquan said airlines were operating 24 flights between China and the United States every week, accounting for just 6 per cent of 2019 levels.

;

;While the demand for more flights existed, “difficulties” in bilateral talks were making it a challenge to increase the number, Xie said.

;

;After flight bans were imposed on Russia in response to its invasion of Ukraine, Moscow retaliated by closing its airspace to some 36 countries, including the US, but not China.

;

;US airlines have said the restrictions give foreign airlines using Russian airspace an advantage, including lower fuel costs, shorter flight times and the ability to carry larger payloads.

; Tue, 06 Jun 2023 00:20:03 +0800 What does China’s manufacturing, services activity from May say about the economic outlook?https://www.scmp.com/economy/economic-indicators/article/3222996/what-does-chinas-manufacturing-services-activity-may-say-about-economic-outlook?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.06 00:00;
;;

;Purchasing managers' indices (PMI) are economic indicators derived from monthly surveys.它们每个月都提供制造业和服务业经济活动的早期迹象。 The services sector includes construction.

;

;A reading above 50 represents an expansion when compared with the previous month, while a reading below 50 represents a contraction. A reading of 50 indicates no change.

;

;So, what do the recent figures say about the state of the world's second-largest economy?

;

;

;

;China's official manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) fell to 48.8 in May from 49.2 in April.

;

;The May reading was the lowest level since the index dropped to 47 in December.

;

;Within the official manufacturing PMI, the new-orders subindex fell to 48.3 in May from 48.8 in April, while the new-export-orders subindex fell to 47.2 from 47.6.

;

;Analysts from HSBC said the “deeper contraction” in the manufacturing PMI, compared with the non-manufacturing gauge that fell to 54.5 from 56.4, “showed an ongoing divergence in the recovery between services and manufacturing”.

;

;“The disappointing May NBS PMIs show signs that the recovery momentum has continued to fade. While policymakers have reiterated a pro-growth stance, more needs to be done to help instill more confidence for households and businesses alike, and to set the growth recovery back on track,” said Greater China economists Erin Xin and Jing Liu.

;

;Meanwhile, the Caixin/S&P Global manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) rose to 50.9 in May, up from 49.5 in April.

;

;Zhou Hao, an economist with Guotai Junan International, said the reading was “good news for the Chinese economy”, but that more time was needed to determine whether the improvement could be sustained.

;

;Demand is the 'culprit' with China's factories facing 'downward spiral'

;

;The Caixin PMI is believed to focus on more export-oriented and small firms in coastal regions and is compiled by S&P Global from responses to questionnaires sent to purchasing managers in China.

;

;But while the Caixin PMI in China, and also a similar survey in Japan, showed swings in factory activity toward growth last month, they stood in contrast to weak indicators from South Korea, Vietnam and Taiwan, where declines continued as sluggish global demand remained a major challenge for many of Asia's big exporters.

;

;

;

;China's official non-manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) fell to 54.5 in May from 56.4 in April.

;

;Within the official non-manufacturing PMI, the services index declined from 55.1 to 53.8, while the construction index also fell from 63.9 to a four-month low of 58.2.

;

;Analysts from Capital Economics said the fall in the construction index suggested that the “prop to infrastructure spending from the front-loading of fiscal support this year is now starting to fade”.

;

;Analysts from Nomura said the resilient non-manufacturing PMI “was mainly backstopped by a burst of suppressed demand for travel and gatherings during the first post-Covid “golden week” holiday.

;

;Domestic tourism revenue had jumped to 101 per cent of pre-pandemic levels, reaching 148 billion yuan (US$20.9 billion), during the five-day holiday from late April to early May.

;

;Meanwhile, the Caixin/S&P Global services purchasing managers' index (PMI) rose to 57.1 in May from 56.4 in April.

;

;China's services activity picks up as orders shore up consumption-led recovery

;

;The survey showed service companies reported a rise in new business as the May Day holiday boosted orders for hotels, restaurants and travel agencies.

;

;Wang Zhe, senior economist at Caixin Insight Group, said “it remains a prominent feature of the Chinese economy that the services sector is stronger than manufacturing”.

;

;

;

;China will release its trade data for May on Wednesday, with inflation data for last month following on Friday.

;

;Beijing has pledged to shore up trade to support the overall economic recovery, but China's exports have struggled due to weak global demand.

;

;China's economic recovery has already been hit by rising youth unemployment, as well as disappointing retail sales and industrial production.

;

;This prompted some international investment banks to cut their full-year economic growth estimates.

;

;But Julian Evans-Pritchard, an analyst at Capital Economics, said that China's second-quarter gross domestic product (GDP) growth “may not be as bad as many fear” after manufacturing output ticked up and the service sector is still seeing decent gains.

;

;“The PMI surveys suggest that China's economic recovery was still ongoing in May. Waning fiscal support weighed on construction activity. But manufacturing output ticked up and the service sector is still seeing decent gains,” said Evans-Pritchard.

;

;“The Caixin composite PMI rose to its highest level since December 2020 in May, thanks to an improvement in the services sector. The official PMIs were less upbeat. But taken together, the data are consistent with faster gains in economic activity last month.

;

;“Currently, the composite PMI points to official [GDP] growth of around 2.5 per cent, quarter on quarter, this quarter (assuming no change in June). That's higher than the 1.8 per cent, quarter on quarter, we have pencilled in for the second quarter, and leaves us comfortable with our above-consensus [gross domestic product] forecast of 6.5 per cent for this year.”
